channel.title: Number Theoretic Database for Twists and others
channel.description: Recent content on Number Theoretic Database for Twists and others

item.title: Data for Algebraic Values
item.description: Let $E$ be an elliptic curve defined over $\mathbb{Q}$ of conductor $N$ and $\mathcal B_k$ be the family of primitive Dirichlet characters of order $k$. Define $$\mathcal{B}_{k,N}(X) = \{\chi \in \mathcal B_k \mid \mathfrak{f}_\chi \leq X \text{ and } \text{gcd}(N, \mathfrak{f}_\chi)=1\}$$ where $\text{gcd}$ is the greatest common divisor function and $\mathfrak{f}_\chi$ is the conductor of $\chi$. The algebraic part of $L(E,1,\chi)$ is defined as $$L_E^{\text{alg}}(\chi) = \frac{2\tau(\overline{\chi})}{\Omega_\chi}L(E,1,\chi)$$ where $\tau(\chi)$ is the Gauss sum of $\chi$ and $\Omega_\chi = \Omega^{\pm}$ is a period df $E$ depending on the signs of $\chi$.

item.title: Data for Central `$L$`-values
item.description: Let $\mathcal B_k$ be the family of primitive Dirichlet characters of order $k$ and define $$\mathcal{B}_{k,N}(X) = \{\chi \in \mathcal B_k \mid \mathfrak{f}_\chi \leq X \text{ and } \text{gcd}(N, \mathfrak{f}_\chi)=1\}$$ where $\text{gcd}$ is the greatest common divisor function and $\mathfrak{f}_\chi$ is the conductor of $\chi$. Moreover, for a fixed $k$ denote $\zeta_k := e^{2 \pi i/k}$ and $Z_k := \big[0, \zeta_k, \zeta_k^2, \ldots, \zeta_k^{k-1}, 1\big]$. Let $E$ be an elliptic curve defined over $\mathbb{Q}$ of conductor $N$.

item.title: Database for Twists
item.description: Let $E$ be an elliptic curve defined over $\mathbb{Q}$ of conductor $N$ and $\chi$ be a Dirichlet character. Then, the $L$-function of an elliptic curve $E$ twisted by $\chi$ is defined by the following Dirichlet series for $\text{Re}(s) > 3/2$: $$L(E, s, \chi) := \sum_{n \ge 1}\frac{\chi(n)a_n}{n^s} = \prod_{p \nmid N}\Big(1 - \frac{\chi(p)a_p}{p^s} + \frac{\chi^2(p)}{p^{2s-1}}\Big)^{-1}\prod_{p \mid N}\Big(1 - \frac{\chi(p)a_p}{p^s}\Big)^{-1}$$ where $a_p$ is the traces of Frobenius of $E$ if $p \nmid N$ and $0, \pm 1$ depending on the reduction type of $E$ modulo $p$ otherwise.

item.title: Jungbae Nam
item.description: I am a number theorist. I obtained my Ph.D degree in Mathematics & Statistics, Concordia University, Montréal, Québec, Canada in 2019 under the supervision of Hershy Kisilevsky and Chantal David. After that I worked as a Research Assistant professor in Mathematics & Statistics, Concordia University, Montréal, Québec, Canada until May 2020. My research areas are Arithmetic and statistics of the special $L$-values of modular forms; Computational algebraic/analytic number theory; Post-quantum cryptography.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Hershy Kisilevsky with Appendix by Jungbae Nam. Small Algebraic Central Values of Twists of Elliptic $L$-Functions, 2021 (Preprint) Data available (HERE) Chantal David and Lucile Devin and Jungbae Nam and Jeremy Schlitt. Lemke Oliver and Soundararajan bias for consecutive sums of two squares, Math.Ann., Nov. 2021 (DOI) (Preprint) (PARI/GP Codes) (Mathematica Codes for Th. 2.1, Prop. 7.1 and 7.2 by Jeremy Schlitt) Chantal David and Matilde Lalín and Jungbae Nam.
